text: Ka, also Sekhem Ka,Michael Rice, Who's Who in Ancient Egypt, Routledge 1999, p.86 was a predynastic pharaoh of Upper Egypt. He ruled over Abydos in the late 32nd or early 31st century BC and was buried at Umm el-Qa'ab. He most likely was the immediate successor to Iry-Hor and was succeeded by Narmer.Ian Shaw, The Oxford History of Ancient Egypt, p.71 He is the earliest known Egyptian king with a serekh, inscribed on a number of artefacts.Toby A. H. Wilkinson, Early Dynastic Egypt, Routledge 1999, pp.57f. ==References== Category:Predynastic Pharaohs
title: Ka (pharaoh)
